item.title: Proposed dockless bike park, 1st November
item.description:
Residents on this road have received advice this morning regarding the installation of 2 dockless bike areas on this road. The letter refers to a letter allegedly sent to us all in August regarding this topic. I like many other residents never received any such letter which now enables the council to push this through with no feedback from the residents, another very sneaky move. I suspect these parking areas will be like many others in the area, bikes being chucked in or not or just left on the pavement causing a hazard to pedestrians and motorists. With no contact point on the latest letter, I hope this finds its way to the relevant oeople dealing with this plan. Come on lewisham get your act together.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Priestfield Road, Perry Vale, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Opposite 12 in the corner, 1st November
item.description:
The whole drain is blocked and even if you try and rod it then it doesn’t move. Which means the main rain in the road itself may be blocked. Which can end up causing the basements to have a sewage surcharge if the main drain in the road is full. It happened before in 2021
